accelerometer_publisher.py
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 import argparse
2 
3 import rospy
4 import rospkg
5 from sensors import IMU
6 from sensor_msgs.msg import Imu
7 ROS_ROBOSKIN_DIR = rospkg.RosPack().get_path('ros_robotic_skin')
8 
9 
10 def parse_arguments():
11  parser = argparse.ArgumentParser()
12  parser.add_argument('--ros_core_ip', type=str, default=None,
13  help="The ros_core_ip in which ros master is running")
14  parser.add_argument('--imu_num', type=int, required=True,
15  help="Publish topic as this given number")
16  parser.add_argument('--raspi_bus_number', type=int, required=True,
17  help="Raspi's bus number for the given specific imu")
18 
19  return parser.parse_args()
20 
21 
22 if __name__ == "__main__":
23  """
24  code for publishing real accelerometer data in ROS.
25  """
26  args = parse_arguments()
27 
28  # Init ROS Node
29  rospy.init_node('talker_{imu_num}'.format(imu_num=args.imu_num), anonymous=True)
30  # Prepare publisher
31  pub = rospy.Publisher('/imu_data{imu_num}'.format(imu_num=args.imu_num), Imu, queue_size=10)
32  r = rospy.Rate(100)
33 
34  # Prepare IMU
35  imu = IMU(ros_core_ip=args.ros_core_ip, raspi_bus_number=args.raspi_bus_number)
36 
37  # Publish IMU topics
38  imu_msg = Imu()
39  while not rospy.is_shutdown():
40  data = imu.read()
41  imu_msg.header.frame_id = 'imu_data{imu_num}'.format(imu_num=args.imu_num)
42  imu_msg.header.stamp = rospy.Time.now()
43  imu_msg.linear_acceleration.x = data[0]
44  imu_msg.linear_acceleration.y = data[1]
45  imu_msg.linear_acceleration.z = data[2]
46  imu_msg.angular_velocity.x = data[3]
47  imu_msg.angular_velocity.y = data[4]
48  imu_msg.angular_velocity.z = data[5]
49  pub.publish(imu_msg)
50  r.sleep()
